fields.description: We are still building pipes out of the old mrv1 directories using ant.  Move it over to the mrv2 dir structure.

comments.body: HADOOP-8368 is changing the c++ stuff over to use cmake so I'm going to wait until that is done to complete this.

Hi Thomas,

This patch might serve as a good starting point for MAPREDUCE-4267.  It doesn't get rid of all the ant build stuff, but it does move the native mapreduce build to use CMake and Maven.

Let me know if you think this should be in a separate JIRA, or if it belongs here.

Thanks Colin.  That is basically what I am working with - I stole your original copy of CMakeList and pom from 8368, although I didn't have all the rm stuff done so this definitely helps.  I need to finish up the assembly stuff, hope to have a patch in the next day or so.

MAPREDUCE-4267.001.trimmed.patch is slightly cleaned up beyond what was in HADOOP-8368.018.trimmed.patch.  I think the biggest improvement is that it now builds both static and shared versions of hadooputils and hadooppipes.  It also handles the 32-bit build correctly, and uses make rather than make install.

Good luck.  I'm looking forward to a fully mavenized mapreduce proj!

* fix pom.xml to skip 'make install' and just call 'make' (it's harmless to call make install here, but unecessary)

* set VERBOSE=1 for the make command, so that we can easily identify all errors.

rm file is the same as previously.

here is an initial patch.  

files added to the tarball are listed below. I'm using the packaging type of pom in the hadoop-pipes pom.xml because all it does it run ant to generate the libraries via cmake and there are no jar files.  If anyone has a better way of doing this let me know.

I'll see if I can figure out a way to tell it not to package the pom.

 hadoop-3.0.0-SNAPSHOT/include/Pipes.hh
> hadoop-3.0.0-SNAPSHOT/include/SerialUtils.hh
> hadoop-3.0.0-SNAPSHOT/include/StringUtils.hh
> hadoop-3.0.0-SNAPSHOT/include/TemplateFactory.hh
38a43
> hadoop-3.0.0-SNAPSHOT/lib/native/libhadooppipes.a
39a45
> hadoop-3.0.0-SNAPSHOT/lib/native/libhadooputils.a
522a529
> hadoop-3.0.0-SNAPSHOT/share/hadoop/tools/lib/hadoop-pipes-3.0.0-SNAPSHOT.pom

This should be run before the patch.

./MAPREDUCE-4267.sh svn
patch -p0 < MAPREDUCE-4267.patch
Looks like the bit I added from HADOOP-8489 broke the build of 32 bit when building from 64 bit machine.  I'll remove that back out.
Sorry looks like my previous comment was wrong, need to debug further.
fix compilation of 32 bit on 64 bit machine - need to use CXX flags.  don't package the pom file.
minor fixes to name examples with "-" instead of "_". (ie wordcount-simple).  Also updated readme.txt.
I tested via running all the example programs and all ran fine.  I also made sure I could build a pipes program from just the headers/libraries distributed in the tarball.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12532567/MAPREDUCE-4267.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    -1 patch.  The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/2474//console

This message is automatically generated.

patch isn't going to apply via jenkins.  You need to run it like:

./MAPREDUCE-4267.sh svn
patch -p0 < MAPREDUCE-4267.patch
The changes look good to me.  +1 I'll check it in.  I am assuming that commented out parts of the pom.xml are for tests and that there will be a follow on JIRA to fix the issues there.
